author: Zephyr @zephyr_z9
text:
The funny thing is that Jensen, Satya, and Demis never had short timelines
Jensen has always pushed "AI factories," not "AGI."
The vibes changed after RL didn't generalize that well, and Karpathy & Ilya started extending their timelines
Sacks and Sriram understand AI economics quite well

Unlike traditional software, where the marginal cost of distribution is zero, AI software has substantial inference/distribution costs (hardware eats the margins)
Not allowing Nvidia hardware in China is basically hurting Nvidia's topline and creating an opportunity to create another AI stack 

Now that "AGI 2027" won't happen, allowing better hardware into China is quite logical
